question: A 60-year-old man is called for a follow-up 2 weeks after his surgery for colon cancer. During the surgery, his tumor was removed and a permanent stoma was made. What is the most likely procedure performed?

A 15-year-old boy presents to the clinic with increased bloating, abdominal pain, and explosive diarrhea upon ingestion of dairy products for the past several months. What is the most likely etiology for this condition?
What is the investigation of choice to determine patency of the distal portion of intestine prior to a defunctioning stoma reversal surgery?
Intestinal chyme stimulates the gastric secretion of about 10% of the acid in response to the meal. This early intestinal phase of stomach secretion is stimulated by which of the following?

A 48-year-old female patient is brought to the emergency department with complaints of severe epigastric pain for 1 day, which became generalized and more severe for 3 hours. The pain is associated with vomiting, and she cannot tolerate even a liquid diet. She has a history of NSAID use for osteoarthritis for a long time. Her pulse is 120 beats/min, her blood pressure (BP) is 100/60 mmHg, she is afebrile, and her respiratory rate is 32 breaths/min. She has a tense tender abdomen with board-like rigidity. Gut sounds are inaudible. What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

A 30-year-old female developed bleeding after excessive bouts of vomiting. The bleeding stopped spontaneously. Upper GI endoscopy showed longitudinal mucosal lacerations in the lower part of the esophagus. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 13-year-old child with a history of type 1 diabetes mellitus presents with intermittent diarrhea, abdominal pain, and vomiting. On examination, he has short stature with anemia, angular stomatitis, and paresthesia. What is the likely clinical diagnosis?

A 26-year-old man suffered a heavy blow on the chin in boxing after which there was the escape of blood and cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) from the nose, and extravasation of blood in the orbit which manifested as a "black eye". Which type of fracture could have led to this?

answers.option: Fracture through the middle cranial fossa
Fracture through the anterior cranial fossa
Fracture through the posterior cranial fossa

question: A 35-year-old male patient was diagnosed with a peptic ulcer for the past 6 months. He is currently on maintenance therapy with H2 (histamine) receptor blockers along with a mucosal protective agent. Recently he complains of loss of libido and physical examination revealed signs of gynecomastia. Gynecomastia is the most common side effect of which of the following drug?

A 28-year-old lady falls from a scooter and gets minor abrasions on the arm and forearm and bruising of the scalp. After reaching home, she has a quarrel with her husband, receives mild blows on the face, and later dies. Autopsy reveals 100 ml of blood beneath a fractured skull at the site of the bruise. What is the probable cause of death?

A 30-year-old girl ingested an unknown substance and died. A post-mortem was carried out to find the cause of death. The oral cavity showed a diffuse grayish-white escharotic appearance. Also, the gastrointestinal (GI) tract was inflamed but the cecum and large intestine showed intense inflammation along with gangrene. What do you think is the probable substance she ingested?

A 30-year-old man got hit on the vertex of the head that led to a fracture of the base of the skull. However, on examination, the bruise was found on the mastoid process behind the ears. What could be the reason for these positive findings of bruises on the mastoid processes?

A 25-year-old man has noted cramping abdominal pain for the past week. On physical examination, there is right upper quadrant tenderness. Laboratory studies show increased serum transaminases. A liver biopsy was performed, and microscopic examination showed focal necrosis, interface inflammation with the extension of inflammation into the lobules from the portal triad. Which of the following is the most likely cause?

A young girl is attacked by thieves who badly injure her with knives. On examination, the wounds are present on her body and arm, clearly cut with no bruising at the wound edges. Gaping is also noted at the edges. In light of the above findings, what is the most probable diagnosis?
Antacid combinations of magnesium and aluminum salts are superior to single-component preparations because of which of the following reasons?

answers.option: Single agents have rapid as well as sustained neutralizing action
Single agents are more likely to affect gastric emptying
Single agents are more likely alter bowel movement

question: A female patient comes to the clinic with complaints of diarrhea along with fever and abdominal cramping. Colonoscopy revealed pseudomembrane formation on colonic mucosa. The patient has a history of long-term intake of antibiotics. She still complains of repeated episodes of colitis. The doctor recommends fecal bacterio-therapy. Which one of the following bacteria is most probably involved?
What does free air under the diaphragm suggest?
While examining a victim, the medicolegal officer writes a medicolegal certificate by mentioning a wound exposing bone without a fracture on the occipital area. How is this injury classified?
Which of the following drugs prevents acid secretion by irreversibly binding to H+/K+ ATPase receptors?
What causes post-operative paralytic ileus?
Which of the following correctly describes the glycemic index?

answers.option: The ability of the liver to maintain blood glucose levels
The ability of the liver to reduce blood glucose levels
The ability of the liver to increase blood glucose levels
The ability of food to increase blood glucose levels
The ability of food to reduce blood glucose levels

question: A friction burn is which type of injury?
Which of the following is a chemical asphyxiant?
What color precipitate is formed after adding 3% tannic acid to blood samples containing carboxyhemoglobin?
Which of the following is a side effect of ribavirin?
On colonoscopy, a surgeon will differentiate the jejunum from ileum by which of the following?
While circulating in the blood, copper largely binds to which of the following proteins?
Which of the following is incorrect regarding split laceration?

answers.option: It can occur on the forehead
It can occur on the scrotal skin
It looks like an incised wound
It occurs due to sudden compression between two hard objects
It is a type of laceration

question: Which of the following is incorrect regarding a stab wound?

answers.option: In this injury bruising around the opening of the wound is seen
It may occur with a knife
It results from piercing with a pointed weapon
It is a wedge shaped opening wound

question: What is a stab wound defined as?

answers.option: Any injury with breach in natural continuity of skin or mucous membranes
Penetration with long narrow, usually pointed, object that is deeper than its length and width
The tearing or splitting of skin, mucous membranes, muscles or internal organs caused by either a shearing or a crushing force
A clean cut wound through the tissues, which is more long than deep
The extravasation of blood in the subcutaneous/subepithelial tissues due to rupture of blood vessels

question: Which of the following is correct regarding age and color of a bruise?
Which of the following is correct regarding hepatorenal syndrome?

answers.option: Laboratory finding consistent with post-renal failure
Diagnosed when serum creatinine < 1.5 despite using diuretics

question: Transport of glucose across the basolateral membrane in intestinal cells occurs through which of the following?

Hepatic encephalopathy is a spectrum of disturbances in consciousness, ranging from subtle behavioral abnormalities to marked confusion and stupor, to deep coma and death. Which of the following is a useful indicator of its prognosis?

A person presents to the emergency department with chronic diarrhea and abdominal pain for months. Findings show aphthous ulcers, deep linear fissures occupying the ascending and transverse colon but sparing the rectum and descending colon with skipped areas with excess fat creeping over mucosa. Cryptitis is also seen in lamina propria along with non-caseating granulomas. Which is the most probable diagnosis?
Which of the following is a cause of bleeding in subdural hematoma?
Which of the following arteries passes behind the first part of the duodenum?
Which of the following colonic polyps is not premalignant?

answers.option: Hamartomatous polyps associated with Peutz-Jeghers syndrome

question: What type of food may cause colon cancer?
Which of the following is the most common clinical presentation of Meckel diverticulum?
Which of the following is the most common site of adenocarcinoma in the small intestine?
Which of the following is the most common tumor of the small intestine?
Which of the following is true about ulcerative colitis with colon cancer?

answers.option: Malignancy is more in anorectal ulcerative colitis
It is related to the duration of ulcerative colitis
It is related to disease activity

question: Gastrointestinal stromal tumors (GISTs) are more commonly found at which of the following locations on the gastrointestinal tract?

While repairing the ileum for a stab wound in a 31-year-old man, a 1 cm circumscribed submucosal mass in the ileum is noticed. Microscopically, the mass is composed of nests of cells with uniform small round nuclei and cytoplasm with small purple granules. The cytoplasm is positive with an antibody to chromogranin. Which of the following pathologic findings is most likely to accompany this man's lesion?

A 20-year-old man is healthy but has a family history of colon cancer with onset at a young age. No abnormal physical examination findings are observed. On colonoscopy, there are over 200 tubular adenomas ranging in size from 0.2 to 1 cm on gross inspection. Which of the following genetic diseases is the man most likely to have?

A 54-year-old alcoholic male presents with sudden onset of severe, constant epigastric pain that radiates to his mid-back. Further evaluation finds fever, steatorrhea, and discoloration around his flank and umbilicus. Lab investigations reveal elevated serum levels of amylase and lipase. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 65-year-old male is operated on for the removal of a pancreatic lesion. The patient's history includes an episode of acute pancreatitis two years prior. The most likely histological feature on microscopic examination is the presence of which of the following?

A 9-year-old child presents with a prolonged history of abdominal discomfort, bloating, constipation, weight loss, and anemia. Serological examination shows positivity for anti-endomysial antibodies. An endoscopic biopsy of the jejunum will most likely show which of the following features?
Which of the following is not a specific feature of dysentery?

answers.option: There is an increase in stool mass

question: A 37-year-old woman with GERD and chronic hepatitis C genotype 1a infection is preparing to begin treatment with ledipasvir/sofosbuvir. Which is the most appropriate information for the patient regarding the use of a proton-pump inhibitor during treatment with ledipasvir/sofosbuvir?

answers.option: Absorption of ledipasvir is increased with increasing pH
The patient should stop using the proton-pump inhibitor
Absorption of sofosbuvir is decreased with increasing pH
Absorption of ledipasvir is not affected by gastric pH
A proton-pump inhibitor can be safely administered with ledipasvir/sofosbuvir without regard to timing of the dose or food intake

question: A 30-year-old woman presents to the clinic with the complaint of a swollen, red, and painful left knee for the past two weeks. She has a 7-month history of bloody diarrhea and crampy abdominal pain. Abdominal palpation reveals tenderness over the left lower quadrant. Labs show a hemoglobin level of 9.3 g/dL. Microscopic examination of her stool reveals occult blood. A diffusely red, bleeding, friable colonic mucosa is visualized by colonoscopy. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 30-year-old female is prescribed a broad-spectrum antibiotic for a severe upper respiratory tract infection. After a few days, the respiratory symptoms improve but the patient now develops abdominal cramps, watery diarrhea, and dehydration. Which of the following organisms is the most likely cause of this patient's condition?
Patients suffering from ulcerative colitis are at risk of suffering from which of the following conditions?
Which of the following is the watershed zone?
A 32-year-old man with hepatitis B refractory to treatments has begun an oral course of lamivudine. The mechanism of action of this medication likely involves which of the following?

A 58-year-old man with a history of occasional GERD presents to the clinic with diarrhea for the past 3 months. He has not been sick and has been feeling quite well otherwise. Which of the following antacids is the most likely to prevent episodes of diarrhea?

A 28-year-old female patient is brought to the emergency department with the complaint of severe generalized body pain for the past 1 day that is associated with vomiting. She has also not passed any stool for the past 2 days. She has had colicky abdominal pain for the past 3 months and has lost a significant amount of weight. She has a pulse of 120 beats per minute, blood pressure of 120/80 mmHg, respiratory rate of 32 breaths per minute, and she is afebrile. She has a distended tense tender abdomen with a tympanic note and her gut sounds are inaudible. What would be the most appropriate radiological investigation to reach a diagnosis for this patient?

A 37-year-old female with mild arthritis presents to the clinic for a follow-up. She states that she is doing much better because of doubling her dose of ibuprofen. The physician warns the patient about peptic ulcers and bleeding from taking too much ibuprofen. She is offered alternatives, but the patient refuses because the ibuprofen works so well. What is the most appropriate therapy for this patient to prevent peptic ulcers?

A 21-year-old male presented to the emergency department with a complaint of colicky abdominal pain off-and-on along with low-grade evening fever for the past 3 months. He has had vomiting for the past 2 days and absolute constipation for 1 day. He has lost 7 kg in the last 3 months. He is anemic, dehydrated, has a pulse of 100 beats per minute, blood pressure of 100 mmHg, and weight of 40 kg. His abdomen is distended and is tympanic on auscultation with tenderness. Gut sounds are inaudible. What would be the most likely diagnosis?

A 32-year-old female presents with the complaint of crampy abdominal pain and loose stools for the past 1 month with a frequency of 6-8/day. The stool was mixed with mucus and blood, with occasional blood clots seen. On examination, she has pallor and is lethargic. Her abdomen is tender in the right and left iliac fossa. A digital rectal examination shows a blood-stained finger with stool. Stool culture yields negative for any growth. Colonoscopy shows diffuse erythema of the entire colon with ulceration and spontaneous bleeding. Histopathology shows an increase in inflammatory cells in the lamina propria. The walls of the crypts of Lieberkuhn are infiltrated by inflammatory cells and there are crypt abscesses. What would be the most likely diagnosis in her case?

A 50-year-old caucasian male presents to the clinic with post-prandial abdominal pain, watery diarrhea, frequent oral aphthous ulceration, and weight loss for the past 6 months. He was advised upper gastrointestinal (GI) endoscopy and colonoscopy by a family physician. The endoscopic appearance is suggestive of cobblestone. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 50-year-old male has been a known case of ulcerative colitis (biopsy proven) for the last 20 years with in-frequent flare-ups in between. He is currently stable on an aminosalicylic acid (5-ASA) regimen. What is the chance of colorectal malignancy in this case?

A 30-year-old woman who has a history of ulcerative colitis for the past 5 years develops severe lower gastrointestinal bleeding necessitating blood transfusions frequently in the last 15 days. She is advised to undergo surgery on an emergent basis. What should be the ideal procedure in this case?

answers.option: Total abdominal colectomy with ileal anastomosis (TAC-IRA)
Restorative proctocolectomy with ileal pouch anal anastomosis (RPC-IPAA)

question: A 40-year-old female presents to the emergency department with severe pain in her right upper abdomen for the past 1 day. Pain radiated toward her right shoulder. On examination, she is febrile and has a severely tender right hypochondrium. Lab investigations show Hb 10 mg/dL and a total leukocyte count of 15,000/mm³. The remainder of her investigations are all normal. Ultrasound shows increased wall thickness of the gall bladder. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 15-year-old male presented to the emergency department with severe pain in his right lower abdomen for the past 1 hour. The pain was initially around the umbilicus but it has now radiated toward the right lower abdomen. The pain gets worse with movement. He is febrile, tachycardic, tachypneic, and has a narrow pulse pressure. He has a tender right iliac fossa with the presence of rebound tenderness. Lab investigations show Hb 15 mg/dL and a total leukocyte count of 25,000/mm³. The remainder of the investigations is all normal. Ultrasound shows a non-compressible tubular structure in the right iliac fossa and fluid in the pelvis. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 40-year-old female presents to the emergency department with severe epigastric pain. She is unable to sit straight and the pain decreases when she leans forward. She is febrile and tachycardic. Abdominal examination reveals severe tenderness in her epigastrium. A diagnosis of acute pancreatitis was made. Serum amylase and lipase levels were elevated. Ultrasound abdomen showed a swollen pancreas. Which of the following laboratory findings indicate a good prognosis?
Which of the following is the definition of a wound?

answers.option: Force is an essential element in its causation
It is caused by a sharp weapon
It is a break in the continuation of tissue
An ulcer is a type of a wound
It is caused by a blunt weapon

question: Which of the following is not related to an abrasion?

answers.option: They are caused by friction of rough object against skin

question: A worker employed in the soldering industry is found to have sideroblastic anemia. He was also found to have wrist and foot drop. He was diagnosed as being chronically exposed to an element at his workplace. What is the mechanism of action of this element?
What defines a bruise?

answers.option: It is the extravasation of blood in the subcutaneous tissue due to blunt trauma
It is caused by a blunt weapon
The weapon used can be recognized
It may help determine the time of affliction

question: Which of the following is true regarding a migratory bruise?

answers.option: May appear away from the impact site

question: A worker who glazes pottery presents to the clinic with the complaint of bluish-black lines at the junction of his gums and teeth. What is the causative agent of these lines?
Which of the following is not true regarding a grinding laceration?

answers.option: May result from fall from height
Caused by heavy weight with avulsion of skin from underlying tissues
Accompanied by extreme extravasation of blood

question: Which of the following is incorrect for an incised wound?

answers.option: It is always caused by a sharp weapon
The maximum measurement of an incised wound is its length

question: A 60-year-old male presented to the emergency department with severe abdominal pain. On examination, his abdomen was soft and non-tender. His X-ray abdomen was done which shows peripheral bowel loops with haustra. What is this segment of the gastrointestinal tract called?
A 40-year-old man presents to the clinic with yellow pigmentation of skin and sclera. Which of the following conditions is the most likely cause of this patient's obstructive jaundice?

answers.option: Cancer in the body of pancreas
Cancer in the head of pancreas

question: Which of the following hormones stimulates the secretion of gastric juice?

A 45-year-old male with peptic ulcer disease presents to the emergency department with an abrupt onset of severe epigastric pain for the past 1 hour. Abdominal examination raises suspicion for an acute surgical abdomen. Which of the following examination findings is not suggestive of perforation?

answers.option: A reactive pleural effusion is frequently seen with gastric perforation
Perforation accounts for two-thirds of peptic ulcer-related deaths
Tympanitic abdomen may indicate free air, confirmed by upright chest X-ray
Chemical peritonitis progresses to abdominal rigidity, bacterial peritonitis, and sepsis
Acute pancreatitis may result from posterior perforation

question: Which of the following is a disadvantage of the "food frequency questionnaire" method of obtaining food intake data?
During a nutritional care plan, which of the following nutritional aspects is a "PES statement" used to present?

A 50-year-old male is admitted to the intensive care unit with severe burns. He weighs 80 kg and has a height of 177 cm. What will be the injury factor that will be used in Long's formula to calculate his daily energy requirement?
Which of the following is an indicator of a nutritionally at-risk adult?

answers.option: Involuntary weight loss of ≥ 5% in a month
Body mass index less than 25 kg/m²
Voluntary weight gain of 6.5 kg in a month

question: Which of the following organs synthesizes albumin?

A country has a growth rate (r) of 3%. Experts want to make policies for better planning and administration. For this purpose, they want to calculate the number of years needed for the population to double, based on the current growth rate. Which of the following options captures the correct population doubling time of the country, based on the given information?
During the evaluation of changes in a subject's body weight, what does a 94% usual body weight (UBW) represent?

A country in central Africa has high mortality and a high birth rate. The experts wish to classify the country's stage of demographic transition. Which of the following correctly captures the stage of the given country?

A 6-year-old girl is brought to the clinic with a history of jaundice for the last 10 days. She has had nausea and vomiting with decreased oral intake for the past 15 days. She has also had an altered state of consciousness for the past 2 days. On examination, she has a Glasgow coma scale score of 10/15 with severe jaundice. Her liver is tender and palpable 2.5 cm below the costal margin. Laboratory testing shows hypoglycemia with deranged liver function test values and a PT-INR > 3.0. What is the most likely diagnosis?

answers.option: Acute liver failure with hepatic encephalopathy
Acute on chronic liver disease with hepatic encephalopathy

question: What are the diagnostic criteria for acute liver failure?

answers.option: Symptoms < 8 weeks with PT-INR > 1.5 and hepatic encephalopathy
Symptoms > 6 weeks with PT-INR > 1.5 and hepatic encephalopathy
Symptoms < 6 weeks with PT-INR > 1.5 and hepatic encephalopathy

question: What is the prime treatment of ascites secondary to portal hypertension?

A middle-aged female presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of gradual distention of the abdomen for the past 4 months and pedal edema for 3 weeks. There is no history of nocturia or periorbital puffiness. Her abdomen is distended and her spleen is palpable three fingers below the costal margin. Shifting dullness is also positive. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is not a precipitating risk factor for hepatitis-induced encephalopathy?

A young male presents to the emergency department with the complaint of blood in vomiting and an altered level of consciousness since last night. Attendants describe that he had four bouts of large-volume, black-colored vomiting after which he became drowsy. On examination, his blood pressure is 90/60 mmHg, pulse is 112 beats per minute, he is drowsy and anemic, and has bipedal edema and clubbing. His abdomen is non-tender with an enlarged spleen and ascites. What is the most likely cause of his bleeding?
In the normal plain X-ray abdomen, the gas shadow in the central part of the abdomen indicates which anatomical segment of the gastrointestinal tract?
Early starvation causes transient changes in basal metabolic rate. With long-standing starvation, which of the following is correct regarding BMR in long-standing starvation?

answers.option: BMR is not affected by the nutritional status of an individual
BMR decreases in long standing starvation
BMR increases in long standing starvation
BMR is not affected by energy expenditure
BMR is not affected by dietary changes

question: Which of the following is described as taking a detailed record of a person's dietary habits, anthropometric measurements, and physical exam findings to figure out the individual need for nutrition based on dietary preference?
A patient presented to the outpatient department with reports that were positive for viral hepatitis. What type of jaundice can be seen in this patient?

answers.option: Jaundice due to sickle cell disease

question: A 40-year-old female patient presented to the outpatient department with the complaint of aching pain in the abdomen anorexia, weight loss, pale stools, and dark-colored urine. Which of the following symptoms in this patient indicate obstructive jaundice?

A one-week-old girl was brought to the emergency department with severe hypoxemia, tachypnea, and costal retractions. History from the family revealed cyanosis, apnea, and occasional arching of the back especially during the feeds, which further worsens the symptoms. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 60-year-old alcoholic male comes to the medical outpatient department with dilated veins in his abdominal region. He has a history of portal hypertension. What is this condition called?

A forensic professor presents a case of a 30-year-old man with a history of head injury and cerebral concussion, who was admitted to an isolated room with his body curled up in the bed and his head under pillows. She further said that this kind of patient dislikes any interference or exposure to light. These patients are not unconscious but pay no attention to their surroundings, and are liable to become aggressive if disturbed. What is the most likely condition in this case?
Which of the following is incorrect about the action of the following drugs?

answers.option: Absorption of calcium carbonate is affected by the consumption of omeprazole
Sucralfate is effective for the treatment of duodenal ulcers
Omeprazole inhibits the release of stomach acid
Milk alkali syndrome is caused by magnesium hydroxide

question: In a clinically stable patient, immediate exploratory laparotomy is indicated in which of the following conditions?
Which of the following is not the cause of extreme weakness and malnutrition in liver cirrhosis?

answers.option: Metabolic changes characterized by reduced energy expenditure
Anorexia and liver decompensation leading to poor dietary intake

question: Which of the following options correctly states the management of subacute partial small bowel obstruction?

answers.option: Intravenous hydration, NPO, nasogastric decompression, monitoring

question: Which of the following is a precursor to the histamine?

A 55-year-old male patient presents to the clinic with complaints of difficulty in swallowing and food getting stuck in the esophagus for the past month. He has a history of gastroesophageal reflux disease for five years but isn't compliant with his medication. He is a smoker, and his BMI is 32 kg/m2. He undergoes endoscopy, which reveals intestinal metaplasia in the lower one-third of the esophagus. Which of the following is associated with this condition?

A 60-year-old male patient presented to the outpatient department with complaints of recurrent attacks of right upper quadrant pain, nausea, vomiting, and intolerance for fatty food. His biopsy reports that were done previously showed that the gallbladder wall was variably thickened, and had an opaque gray-white appearance along with buried crypts of epithelium within the gallbladder wall. Outpouchings of the mucosal epithelium through the wall were also visible. Which of the following conditions is closely associated with the above-mentioned symptoms?
Which of the following is the extra-intestinal manifestation of ulcerative colitis?
Which of the following can be used in the treatment of human immunodeficiency virus as a part of antiretroviral therapy in case of a high degree of resistance to lamivudine and emtricitabine?
Which of the following drugs for treating hepatitis has nephrotoxic effects?
Which of the following drugs can be prescribed to sensitize a patient who wishes to leave alcohol addiction?

A 40-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with complaints of jaundice, pruritus, and skin xanthomas. The senior doctor says that biopsy reports of the patient show elongated green-brown plugs of bile visible in dilated bile canaliculi. Some canaliculi are ruptured, which causes extravasation of bile, and droplets of bile pigment accumulated within hepatocytes, show a foamy appearance, also called feathery degeneration. Which of the following laboratory investigations can confirm the diagnosis of cholestasis?

answers.option: Elevated serum alkaline phosphatase and γ-glutamyl transpeptidase

question: A 70-year-old man was brought to the hospital due to his cardiac conditions. Upon history, it was found that he has no physical activity in his daily schedule and oil is often reused in home-cooked food for the cooking. After a detailed examination, the doctor suggested a change in his sedentary lifestyle and dietary habits. The change is necessary to produce which of the following outcomes?

answers.option: To increase free radicals in diet

question: What is true about the oxidative rancidification of oils?

answers.option: Oxygen reacts with the unsaturated fatty acids
Carbondioxide reacts with the saturated fatty acids
Rancid oil has increased omega fatty acids

question: A man with chronic liver failure due to hepatitis B was brought to the hospital. His imaging reports show regenerative parenchymal nodules with fibrous bands and variable degrees of vascular shunting. Which of the following best describes the mentioned condition?

A 35-year-old female patient reports having epigastric abdominal pain for the last 7 months and has also lost 10 kg weight during this time. She is currently taking proton pump inhibitors (PPI) for her Barrett esophagus. She has recently been experiencing dysphagia and is a heavy smoker with no history of steroids or NSAIDs. What she is at risk of developing?

A 9-year-old child presents with a prolonged history of abdominal discomfort, bloating, constipation, weight loss, and anemia. Serological examination shows positivity for anti-endomysial antibodies. An endoscopic biopsy of the jejunum shows villous atrophy. Which of the following should be avoided?
Which of the following is the effect of misoprostol on the gastrointestinal tract?
A patient with chronic liver disease and cirrhosis develops thrombocytopenia due to which of the following reasons mainly?

A 20-year-old woman consults her physician with recurrent abdominal pain, bloating, and discomfort for the last 6 months. She also complains of altered bowel habits, predominantly diarrhea. Her abdominal pain improves after passing stool. There is no history of fever and weight loss. Physical examination is unremarkable. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 52-year-old female presented to the emergency department with jaundice, increased heart rate nausea, sweating, and progressive right upper quadrant pain. She had a history of pale stools and dark-colored urine. Ultrasound showed intracanalicular cholestasis and dilated bile canaliculi but there were no signs of necrosis, fibrosis, or iron deposition. What could be the cause of her clinical picture?

A 50-year-old male presented to the outpatient department with a complaint of right upper quadrant pain along with jaundice, dark urine, and pale stools. Radiographic studies of the gallbladder showed dilated segments alternating with fibrotic areas of intra and extra-hepatic ducts. What would be the most likely diagnosis?
A patient starts having diarrhea after taking antibiotics during his hospital stay. Which organism is most likely involved?

A patient presented to the outpatient department with a history of liver enlargement, pain, hyperbilirubinemia, and ascites. Imaging showed multiple venous thrombi in hepatic veins. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the data recording events in the population such as death, birth, social and economic status termed as?
Which hormone is associated with increased appetite, especially during fasting and overeating in obese patients?
Which of the following is the side effect of magnesium hydroxide on the gut?
Which of the following is a convenient treatment option for the HCV genotype-1?
Which of the following antiviral drugs used in the treatment of hepatitis is most likely to cause anemia in the patient?
Which of the following is the most relevant statement regarding the H2 receptor blockers?

answers.option: They cause fastest healing of duodenal ulcers
They are most efficacious drug in inhibiting gastric acid secretion
They are commonly used drug to decrease gastric acid secretion
They afford most prompt relief of ulcer pain

question: Which of the following drugs causes non-competitive inhibition of the H2 receptors?
What is the role of carbenoxolone in treating ulcers?

A child presented to the clinic with complaints of weight loss, chronic diarrhea typically triggered after eating wheat bread, nausea, and itchy rashes/blisters on the extensor surfaces of the body. Which of the following is the clinical diagnosis if the child appears anemic on examination?

A 2-month-old child presented to the outpatient department with the complaint of watery frothy diarrhea and abdominal distention after milk ingestion. The child was exclusively breastfed, and stool volume was less than 200 mg/24 hours. What is the diagnosis?

A child from a consanguineous marriage is brought to the outpatient department with the complaint of pneumonia and other recurrent respiratory tract infections and fatty stools. What could be the most likely diagnosis?

A woman presents to the emergency department with a complaint of severe abdominal pain, and constipation for a few days. She is a mother to 4 children all born via c-section. What could be the cause of her condition?
Age and gender are found in which graphical representation in the form of histogram?
A 15-year-old boy with suspected acute appendicitis has an Alvarado score of 5-6. Which of the following would be the most appropriate next step in the management of this patient?
Secretions of which of the following is totally under neuronal control?

A 40-year-old male presents to the emergency with complaints of nausea, and right upper quadrant pain. There is no history of jaundice. Laboratory investigations reveal a total leucocyte count (TLC) of 12,000 cells/dl with 91% neutrophils. Which of the following is the most likely cause of the patient's condition?
A 35-year-old patient presents to the clinic with crampy abdominal pain, flatulence, and constipation. Which of the following should be avoided in order to improve the symptoms in this patient?
Which of the following is used to calculate the amount of body fat, by using the weight and height, and is different in males and females?

A man presents to the hospital with an altered level of consciousness two hours after falling in the washroom. He has pinpoint pupils with a pulse of 78 beats per minute, a blood pressure of 180/120 mmHg, and a fever of 107°F despite antipyretics. Sponging is also of no use. What is the most likely cause of fever?

A 30-year-old female is brought to the emergency room with severe abdominal pain. Two years ago, the woman had a lower gastrointestinal endoscopy, which revealed skip lesions and serpentine ulcers in the colon. Her pulse is 120 beats per minute. X-ray reveals air under the diaphragm. Which of the following conditions is most likely the cause of the current symptoms of the patient?
A 25-year-old man is brought to the emergency after being stabbed in the thigh in the middle of a robbery. Which of the following is the most important dimension to measure in case of a stab wound?

A 45-year-old woman presents to the outpatient department with complaints of malodorous, greasy stools along with right upper quadrant pain. A percutaneous transhepatic cholangiography is done, and the X-ray reveals masses in the gallbladder and cystic duct along with the dilation of bile canaliculi. Which of the following will have the highest elevation in serum when liver function test (LFTs) is done?

A 30-year-old man presented to the outpatient department with complaints of bleeding per rectum for 2 years. On colonoscopy, there was a diffuse inflammation of the rectum and sigmoid colon with superficial mucosal ulcers. A biopsy was performed. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 40-year-old male presents to the emergency department with generalized abdominal pain and board-like rigidity. He has a history of chronic NSAID use. An abdominal X-ray reveals air under the diaphragm. Which of the following conditions is most likely the cause of this patient's condition?

A 30-year-old alcoholic is brought to the emergency department with blood-containing vomit. He is given adequate treatment. After a few days, an upper gastrointestinal endoscopy is performed which reveals healed longitudinal tears in the lower third of the esophagus. Which of the following is the most likely cause of the patient's condition?

A 50-year-old female comes to the hospital with complaints of right upper quadrant pain after eating fatty meals. In general appearance, the woman is obese. X-ray shows masses in the gall bladder. The presence of gallstones is confirmed and the woman undergoes laparoscopic cholecystectomy, which reveals jet-black stones that are soft and glassy in appearance. Which of the following is the major composition of the gallstones in this patient?

A 50-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with complaints of abdominal pain and yellowing of the sclera. Which of the following is the best first-line investigation to do in this patient?

A 20-year-old female presents to the outpatient department with right upper quadrant pain and pruritis along with severe diarrhea for the past 1 month. A percutaneous transhepatic cholangiogram is performed on the patient, which reveals a beaded appearance of the extrahepatic bile ducts. Which of the following is the most likely cause of diarrhea in this patient?
Which of the following is the investigation of choice in a person who developed colonic strictures after a large bowel resection is done due to a colorectal carcinoma?

A 30-year-old male is brought in an unconscious state to the emergency department after a road traffic accident. After regaining consciousness, the patient realizes that he can neither feel nor move his lower limbs. On examination, the gut sounds are absent, and the doctor suspects paralytic ileus. Which of the following is the most likely cause of the patient's condition?

A 63-year-old male, who is a heavy smoker, complains of food sticking behind his sternum for the last 5 months. He has lost considerable weight and appears malnourished. Upper gastrointestinal endoscopy and biopsy confirm the malignant growth. What should be assessed first before commencing the therapy?

answers.option: CT scan of abdomen and chest

question: Apart from ammonia, which of the following substances also accumulate in the blood in case of acute liver failure?

What is the appropriate treatment strategy for a patient with a positive HBsAg, positive HbE, a hepatitis B viral load of 40,000 /dl, coexisting hepatitis C genotype 1, and a fibro scan result indicating the F2 fibrosis stage?

answers.option: No treatment required as viral load is low
